Articles.Content: I've seen the equation around here before, but I can't seem to find it anymore. Does anyone know the formula for escape velocity? I know it's something about taking the square root of the orbital velocity and multiplying by something or another or something like that.

sqrt(2GM/r), or ~1.4*(circular) orbital speed.

(G is the gravitational constant, M is the mass of what you're orbiting/want to escape from, and r is how far away from it you currently are)

or you can use this handy table that has the escape velocity and orbital velocities for heights from 35 km to 950 km spaced every 5 km

https://gist.github.com/1075144
